image.altText: A man wearing a white cap and a black shirt with the words"ACT suicide free by 2033".

props.synopsis: John Veloudos has achieved the feat of running 100km, after just three months of training.

title.children: 'It just took absolutely everything': How to run an ultramarathon

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A jury in the trial of a NSW police officer accused of the manslaugher of great-grandmother Clare Nowland has been shown CCTV and police body-cam footage of her tasering, and told she weighed less than 50 kilograms after her death.

title.children: 95yo great-grandmother tasered by police officer in Cooma weighed 47.5kg at autopsy, court told

image.altText: A close up of a nsw police officer

props.synopsis: The new pay offer, to be voted on later this month, will see more than 10,000 officers receive at least a 25 per cent pay rise.

title.children: NSW police officers offered pay rise of up to 39pc in 'highest increase in last 30 years'

image.altText: An auctionerr, facing away from the camera, facing towards a man and woman.

props.synopsis: There are more sellers than buyers in the Canberra property market, as a new report finds home values declined over the last three months.

title.children: Canberra home values are declining — but it's only a buyers' market for those who can save a deposit

image.altText: A man stands with a hand on his hip, wearing a uniform and medals, smiling.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 106th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: Boy smiling with award in hand and medal around neck

props.synopsis: A coroner says wearing a life jacket may have increased 16-year-old Jack Bird's chances of survival when he was thrown from his boat into rough water on a lake near the Victorian-NSW border.

title.children: Teenage boy's drowning prompts call for stronger life jacket laws in NSW

image.altText: A white alpaca on a lead, held by a man in a black polo, is stroked on the neck by an elder woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Though the world may remember Hephner for his unforgettable sneeze on King Charles, the alpaca has already made a name for himself around Canberra through many philanthropic endeavours.

title.children: Why Hephner the alpaca makes regular visits to those in palliative care

image.altText: Students walk in a protest carrying signs. One signs reads 'Ceasefire now'.

props.synopsis: ANU Vice-Chancellor Genevieve Bell did not say if security consultants monitored pro-Palestinian students' social media activity.

title.children: ANU spent almost $1 million responding to pro-Palestinian student protests, Vice-Chancellor says

image.altText: A Rex aircraft seen through a window at an airport terminal, in the foreground inside are airport seats.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a bailout for Rex Airlines, while an ACCC report has revealed domestic airfares have risen since Rex's collapse.

title.children: Airline industry faces day of reckoning with coordinated reports and inquiries

image.altText: Barron Trump and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in a split screen image.

props.synopsis: In the wash-up of the United States presidential election, it is becoming increasingly clear that it is impossible to divide American voters the way pollsters and strategists have in the past.

title.children: Barron Trump and AOC expose the problems with the Democratic campaign

image.altText: Shark bites a seal shaped decoy

props.synopsis: Researchers believe their work could mean a "revolution" in surfboard design that is potentially beneficial here in Australia.

title.children: LED lighting on surfboards may deter great white sharks from attacking surfers

image.altText: A Regional Express (REX) aircraft unloads at Charleville Airport in south-west Queensland.

props.synopsis: Qantas defended itself from allegations of "slot hoarding" at a heated Senate inquiry, while the federal government gave regional airline Rex an $80 million lifeline as its voluntary administration is extended. Catch up on the day's events and insights live on ABC's markets blog.

title.children: Rex given $80m bailout, while ACCC warned Qantas controls 65pc of market and prices are up, ASX loses ground — as it happened

image.altText: Federal Liberal Leader Peter Dutton in Perth

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the arrival of four foreign nationals on a remote NT island demonstrates the Albanese government's "weak" border security — as it happened.

title.children: Dutton says latest foreign national arrival shows Australia is considered 'weak' by 'people smugglers'  — as it happened

image.altText: Night shot of house with glowing flames behind it

props.synopsis: The Freeman siblings escaped the blaze with just the clothes they were wearing after feeling the heat and smelling smoke from the cabin next door.

title.children: Family of five left homeless after fire rips through affordable housing complex

image.altText: Four people walk in the shallows of a coastline, with white backs slung over their shoulders

props.synopsis: The Northern Land Council says the four men landed on Australia's northern coastline on Monday.

title.children: Four foreign nationals found on remote NT island say they paid money to be taken to Australia

image.altText: Uranus

props.synopsis: A fresh look at data on Uranus from 1986 has prompted NASA scientists to suggest the planet could support life.

title.children: Scientists' beliefs about Uranus proved wrong as data reassessed from a five-day fly-by in 1986

image.altText: New Zealand's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon

props.synopsis: An estimated 200,000 people in state, foster and faith-based care suffered "unimaginable" abuse over a period of seven decades, a report released in July said.

title.children: New Zealand's prime minister formally apologises to survivors of abuse in state and church care

image.altText: Plane on tarmac

props.synopsis: Community leaders in WA say Rex Airlines needs to improve its poor service record and pay its outstanding bills after being thrown a lifeline.

title.children: Regional communities want higher standards alongside $80m Rex lifeline

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: An engineer tells a Tasmanian court if "all eight star pickets were used" to anchor a jumping castle at the centre of a 2021 tragedy, it "would have endured the event" in which six children died.

title.children: Jumping castle would have stayed on ground if eight anchors were used, engineer tells court examining 2021 Hillcrest tragedy

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: Mohamed Ahmed Omer was found guilty of secretly withdrawing support for his former wife's visa application before abandoning her on an overseas trip.

title.children: Victorian man jailed for four and a half years after abandoning former wife in Sudan

image.altText: Man in striped suit walking down steps

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason will resign as a Tasmanian Supreme Court judge after being found guilty of assault and emotional abuse, and pleading guilty to breaching a family violence order.

title.children: Judge to quit Supreme Court as 'the destruction of his public image and professional life is total'

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on, with chin resting on his hand. He is seen from close, with only his head, shoulders and hand visible

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's White House is continuing to take shape, with the US president-elect announcing hardliner Tom Homan will oversee his strict immigration blueprint, among other key appointments.

title.children: Donald Trump announces Stephen Miller, Mike Waltz as cabinet expands

image.altText: Old photo of man fixing kite

props.synopsis: Australian inventor Lawrence Hargrave created history when he was lifted off the ground in a flying device he created in 1894. Now, 130 years later, he is remembered as a generous pioneer whose engineering breakthroughs influenced the world's first aeroplanes.

title.children: Australian aviation pioneer Lawrence Hargrave celebrated 130 years after first heavier-than-air flight

image.altText: A grainy, dark picture of two young girls smiling, wearing warm caps.

props.synopsis: The years-long hunt for the killer of two young girls in a small Indiana town may finally be over after a jury finds a local man guilty.

title.children: 'Today was the day': Almost eight years after Abby and Libby were murdered, a jury hands down a guilty verdict

image.altText: Tolutau Koula, Haumole Olakau'atu and Felise Kaufusi put their hands on their hearts during the Tongan national anthem.

props.synopsis: The understood hierarchy in international men's rugby league has been shattered by the rising Pasifika teams, but there are concerns from across the ditch that the scales are tipping too far.

title.children: Why 'New Zealand are worried' about the rising powers of Tonga and Samoa

image.altText: Cricket Australia CEO Nick Hockley, wearing a suit jacket, no tie, speaking at a press conference at the MCG during the day

props.synopsis: Nick Hockley has defended the decision to rest several Test stars for the series-deciding ODI against Pakistan, which Australia lost by eight wickets.

title.children: Cricket Australia CEO defends ODI selections after former captain says they 'didn't care about losing'

image.altText: white and yellow snake in a container

props.synopsis: Wildlife authorities received a tip-off before raiding the woman's home where they found dozens of snakes, lizards and eggs.

title.children: Queensland woman fined $20,000 for illegally buying and selling reptiles

image.altText: A woman holds a trophy aloft as people look on in Italy.

props.synopsis: When you hit the water from 20 metres up and are moving at 85 kilometres per hour there is no room for error. Rhiannan Iffland has turned doing it with dominance into an art form.

title.children: 'You need to be a daredevil': Australia's cliff diving world champion Rhiannan Iffland on what drives her

image.altText: An elderly couple down a mall with the help of a younger woman.

props.synopsis: An aging and geriatric medicine specialist says the project, led by researchers at the University of Queensland, shows people who maintain better health in their mid and later life are more likely to prevent dementia.

title.children: 'New hope' for dementia early intervention after study finds link between frailty and the disease

image.altText: a man in a black sweater leans against the front door of his house

props.synopsis: As the number of people facing a lifetime of renting soars, research reveals many Australian renters would pay more to secure long-term leases and homes that are above the minimum required standard.

title.children: Renters face 'a real social divide' as some say they would pay more for a 'forever' lease

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman holding up a piece of fabric with artwork on it

props.synopsis: First Nations artist Jacinta Numina-Waugh speaks out after she was allegedly subject to unconscionable sales conduct by Optus that has landed the telco in court.

title.children: 'I feel really ripped off': Artist slams Optus after alleged unconscionable sales conduct

image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin in conversation

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has reportedly called Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the war in Ukraine ahead of a meeting with United States President Joe Biden, but the Kremlin denies the two have spoken.

title.children: Kremlin says reports Trump spoke with Putin 'pure fiction'

image.altText: An image of what appears to be aircraft debris.

props.synopsis: Firefighters at Sydney Airport have found small pieces of metal in long grass near the runway where a Qantas flight suffered an engine failure, triggering a grassfire.

title.children: Metal particles found in 'very unusual' discovery near runway after Qantas flight engine failure, grassfire
